name: topontopi

body.origin:
|- wcel(c0, ctop)
-| wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c0, ctop))
body.pretty:
⊢ c0 ∈ Top
⊣ c0 ∈(TopOn ` c1)
⊣ (c0 ∈(TopOn ` c1)→ c0 ∈ Top)

cumulated.origin:
|- wcel(c0, ctop)
-| wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, c1)), wcel(c0, ctop))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ c0 ∈ Top
⊣ c0 ∈(TopOn ` c1)
⊣ (c0 ∈(TopOn ` c1)→ c0 ∈ Top)

comment: A topology on a given base set is a topology. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Aug-2015.)
